title: What makes something a history? - Quora

response.answer_text: “The whole series of past events connected with a particular person or thing.” Anything is classed as history… something more so than others. To you your childhood is your history. An event like the gold rush is considered a vital piece of American history. However if the same thing on the same scale took place in Europe it wouldn’t be so important as it would be overshadowed be much bigger and and more important events. Certain events that have had a much bigger impact of current events have less notoriety. For example with out the civil war america wouldn’t be very different form the current day; Without the Spanish Armada… America would be completely different, It wouldn’t be called america, everyone would speak Spanish and Mexico would probably be richer.
